content: hey @WG-async-foundations, time for our meeting
Niko can't make it today, and I'm still catching up a bit from being on vacation last week
I would say we can do issue triage, but it doesn't look like there are any new issues to triage :)
If you haven't already seen it, check out the Harmonic synthesis thread
I think feedback on this would be the most helpful thing at the moment
thinking about shiny futures you can write based on it can help
and if any you want to write are missing, etc
I'm going to finish catching up on discussions here today
I'm making progress on https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/80658
Currently only have a few hours each Sun to work on it, but it's getting there!
I also looked into #84841 a bit, and posted a comment about my progress
Does anyone else have status updates, etc. that they'd like to share?
As always, if you are looking to get involved in technical work, the project board has a sizable backlog

tmandry said:

If you haven't already seen it, check out the Harmonic synthesis thread

Is HS solely based on status quo stories?
Status quo stories and the conversations Niko and I (mostly Niko) had on the way to producing them, I'd say

tmandry said:

As always, if you are looking to get involved in technical work, the project board has a sizable backlog

Happy to mentor if there's something you're interested in picking up

Nell Shamrell-Harrington said:

I'm making progress on https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/80658

lmao this may be partially my fault: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/81496/files
#72117 might be a good starting point
I'm a Niklaus and trying to figure out the bounds of what a Niklaus shiny future might look like.

tmandry said:

tmandry said:

As always, if you are looking to get involved in technical work, the project board has a sizable backlog

Happy to mentor if there's something you're interested in picking up

Noted. If I choose something do I PM you? What is the protocol for requesting your guidance?
You could do that or even better, make a new topic in this stream and tag me in it
@Gus Wynn we donâ€™t know that yet ;)
oh sorry, I thought you were talking about my issue
anyway, I think we can wrap up then
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
Thanks all :wave:

Doc Jones said:

tmandry said:

If you haven't already seen it, check out the Harmonic synthesis thread

Is HS solely based on status quo stories?

Actually there were some shiny future conversations included in the mix, IIRC. But one of the ideas was that this would help focus and spur more shiny future stories.

Hello guys, so I just started learning asynchronous in rust and how to use the future trait and all.
So I'm a bit confused because I just started learning rust 5 months ago.

So is there like a session where you guys have a meeting and explain some things in rust or can anyone recommend a good way of learning them
Are you looking for guidance on learning asynchronous Rust?

Yes!
Not only just asynchronous Rust though
You can learn about asynchronous Rust in the Tokio tutorial. That page also has links to two places that are good places for questions regarding how to use asynchronous Rust.
Thank you very much Alice.
But still expect more questions from me, if you don't mind please

If you follow the link to the discord server on the page I linked you, then I am often around there, answering questions. :)
This zulip channel is not really the place for questions about using async Rust.

@Nathaniel Bajo Also see fasterthanlime's async walkthrough: https://fasterthanli.me/articles/surviving-rust-async-interfaces

They have quite a few good tutorials that start from nothing and go quite deep into understanding how things work.
Thank you.
